Quicksilver: History, Medicinal Uses, and Alchemical Properties
Quicksilver, also known as Mercury, is the only known
pure metal to be in a liquid state at normal temperatures.\n<Book>
Skip ahead to where we can find some.\n<Romeo>
Okay... Let's see... "Can be used as a laxative?"
Who was the first person to try this?
"Can be highly toxic." ...That doesn't sound useful
Though rare, mercury deposits tend to be highly concentrated.
Most deposits are in the form of cinnabar. Through a distillation
process described in chapter 7, mercury may be extracted.\n<Book>
Cinnabar ore can be found in areas with volcanic activity, as

Okay, we have some information on each of the items. Let's
A Brief History of South Harbor\n<Book>
Known today as South Harbor, the city was originally constructed
in the 143rd year of the Neim Empire. Constructed by the empire,
the city's name was designated Atheport.\n<Book>
Intially constructed for the purpose of being a fortress city,
high stone walls were built on the shore of the main island.
As the city expanded across the eastern river, another wall
was constructed to hold a second district.\n<Book>
Of course, the city was not constructed as a fortress on the
Emperor's whim. At the time, the Neim Empire was agressively
trying to gain more territory from the eastern half of the
continent, and planned to use the city as a staging point of invasion.\n<Book>
However, a problem arose that the empire's leaders did not account
for. The man in charge of the construction project, Edwin Bright,
hired workers and ordered materials from outside the empire.\n<Book>
These actions are believed to have been fueled by simple greed,
as during the Rebellion of Freedom an amount of gold coins
equivalent to around ten percent of the construction budget was
By utilizing non-empire resources and workers, the strict hold
that the empire held on its other territories was not to be found
in Atheport. During construction, and for several years after,
people of all races could be found within its walls.\n<Book>
When it came time for the empire to call upon Atheport, to
be used as the staging point for war, the majority of citizens
seized control from the empire's commanders. With the city under
their control, they declared separation from the empire.\n<Book>
Following the declaration, the army that had been sent to fortify
the city, were instead told to retake it. With many of their
citizens untrained, Atheport found themselves warily trusting
in the walls of the city to protect them.\n<Book>
It was during this seige that a visiting relative escaped back
to the east, calling upon the armies of the Lailum Kingdom
for assistance. Seeing this as a chance to secure the border,
Lailum sent a small force towards Atheport.\n<Book>
Atheport, seeing that the kingdom was willing to help them,
accepted their offer. With soldiers now capable of defending
against the empire, the empire's army was forced to give up on
The Lailum kingdom and Atheport then came to an agreement.
The Lailum army would stay to train the citizens of Atheport,
and Atheport would be responsible for helping protect the
border between the empire and kingdom.\n<Book>
Now able to defend themselves, the city renamed themselves
South Harbor, to separate themselves from the empire. To
celebrate, they also held a festival. In future years, this
Although the city lies at a strategic point for the empire,
there have not been many major incidents since their separation.
